PLACEMENT SERVICE - PAGE 2 DECEMBER, 1955
December 8. A young educational radio producer with workshop training in tele¬
vision wants a chance with a television operation, either station or production
center. College graduate in radio broadcasting, now doing graduate work in
theatre. Location immaterial, salary over $4500,
December 9. A mature man with six years experience in educational broadcasting
now desires to move into a supervisory or managerial position. Proven writer and
editor. Location immaterial, salary open,
December 10, A young (26) married man with seven years experience in radio is
interested in educational television production. He has a B.S. in speech, with
a radio major and a theatre minor. Currently an NBC Radio Production Director,
and would be interested in a good radio position. Needs $4800,
December 11, A television electronics engineer, instructor and technical writer
desires a position which will utilize his background. B.S. degree plus over thir¬
teen years experience in electronics; project engineer on three important commer¬
cial stations for network. Formal training in industrial management and cost
controls prepared material for FCC applications and analyzed competitors’ applica¬
tions. Also prepared technical lectures, demonstration materials and other train¬
ing matter. Substantial experience in teaching radio, television, allied physics
and mathematics. Prefers New York City or nearby, area. Salary open,
December 12. A radio-television chief engineer is now available. Thoroughly
acquainted with practical and theoretical methods of operation as gained through
21 years in the broadcasting field. Experienced in building, operating and pro¬
moting both radio and television. Prefers Eastern half of the country, but will
go anywhere in the United States if conditions are right. Expect good salary.
